results.content: This is an excellent course and must have for any serious Magento Developer. The instructor's style of teaching is very clear and to the point without any kind of "fluff". I hope to see more courses like these from this instructor!

response.content:
Hello, Brian.

It's a pleasure to have you around.

results.content:
Pour la première session sur Magneto Debug, je trouve dommage que l'on ait pas l'explication pour installer le module. 

Les outils présentés sont intéressants, dommage que certains soient payants.
results.content_html:
Pour la première session sur Magneto Debug, je trouve dommage que l'on ait pas l'explication pour installer le module.

results.content:
When I saw Magicento I was like "code completion for Magento, whaaaat ...?! :D " 
Also, XMLLint was epiphany for me as well :)
After completing the entire course I can say X-Debug setup (at least basic one, because of numerous variations) is a must.
Definitive recommendation for anyone interested on the topic.

response.content:
Thanks for the review, Milan. Nice you liked the content and the hints. 
XDebug is really complicated to setup, because it varies a lot on every environment. Every person should invest some time trying to find out how to setup. Every time I format or change my environment, I spend at least 40 minutes trying to make it work again. So, almost impossible to have it in the course. :(
Anyway, thank you again for the valuable review.
response.content_html:
Thanks for the review, Milan. Nice you liked the content and the hints.
XDebug is really complicated to setup, because it varies a lot on every environment. Every person should invest some time trying to find out how to setup. Every time I format or change my environment, I spend at least 40 minutes trying to make it work again. So, almost impossible to have it in the course. :(

results.content: basic details only. I wanted to know how to setup a magento project with a template I purchased in an IDE , preferrably Eclipse. What eclipse version to download and how to start setup and run /debug the application. I want to study the data flow in magento integrated with my template and how i can create a new section on my store, e.g. , if i want ta new category view on my store , how do i code for it. What is the structure of that code.

response.content:
Thank you for your feedback, Harris.
This is not the objective of this course. I can recommend you "Fundamentals Of Magento Development" course, from Ben Marks, available at Magento U, for this purpose.
